taxon_identification.name_authority_date: Bromus hordeaceus subsp. molliformis (J. Lloyd ex Billot) Maire & Weiller

bio:treatment.description: Culms 15-25(60) cm. Panicles to 10 cm, usually with more than 1 spikelet. Lemmas (7)8-11 mm, pubescent, margins rounded; awns less than 0.1 mm wide at the base, often divaricate or recurved at maturity. Caryopses shorter than the paleas.
bio:treatment.discussion: Bromus hordeaceus subsp. molliformis grows in California and other scattered locations, including Idaho, New Mexico, and southern Michigan.
